intro: Acinodendron panduratum, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release small, smooth seeds. Acinodendron panduratum is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
